verses.verse: O <S%H3068>Lord<s%> <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H3444>salvation<s%>, I have <S%H6817>cried<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%> and night before <S%H3915>you<s%>:
Let my <S%H8605>prayer<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H5186>you<s%>: incline your <S%H241>ear<s%> unto my <S%H7440>cry<s%>;
For my <S%H5315>soul<s%> is <S%H7646>full<s%> of <S%H7451>troubles<s%>: and my <S%H2416>life<s%> draws <S%H5060>near<s%> unto the <S%H7585>grave<s%>.
I am <S%H2803>counted<s%> with them that go <S%H3381>down<s%> into the <S%H953>pit<s%>: I am as a <S%H1397>man<s%> that has no <S%H353>strength<s%>:

<S%H2670>Free<s%> among the <S%H4191>dead<s%>, like the <S%H2491>slain<s%> that <S%H7901>lie<s%> in the <S%H6913>grave<s%>, whom you you <S%H2142>remember<s%> no <S%H1504>more<s%>: and they are cut off from your <S%H3027>hand<s%>.
You have <S%H7896>laid<s%> me in the <S%H8482>lowest<s%> <S%H953>pit<s%>, in <S%H4285>darkness<s%>, in the <S%H4688>deeps<s%>.
Your <S%H2534>wrath<s%> lies <S%H5564>hard<s%> upon <S%H6031>me<s%>, and you have afflicted me with all your <S%H4867>waves<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.

You have put <S%H7368>away<s%> my <S%H3045>acquaintance<s%> <S%H7368>far<s%> from <S%H7896>me<s%>; you have made me a <S%H8441>abomination<s%> unto <S%H3607>them<s%>: I am shut up, and I cannot come <S%H3318>forth<s%>.

My <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H1669>mourns<s%> by reason of <S%H6040>affliction<s%>: <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, I have <S%H7121>called<s%> <S%H3117>daily<s%> upon <S%H7849>you<s%>, I have stretched out my hands unto <S%H3709>you<s%>.
Will you <S%H6213>show<s%> <S%H6382>wonders<s%> to the <S%H4191>dead<s%>? shall the <S%H7496>dead<s%> <S%H6965>arise<s%> and <S%H3034>praise<s%> <S%H5542>you<s%>? Selah.
Shall your <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%> be <S%H5608>declared<s%> in the <S%H6913>grave<s%>? or your <S%H530>faithfulness<s%> in <S%H11>destruction<s%>?
Shall your <S%H6382>wonders<s%> be <S%H3045>known<s%> in the <S%H2822>dark<s%>? and your <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H5388>forgetfulness<s%>?
But unto you have I <S%H7768>cried<s%>, O <S%H3068>Lord<s%>; and in the <S%H1242>morning<s%> shall my <S%H8605>prayer<s%> meet <S%H6923>you<s%>.
<S%H3068>Lord<s%>, why cast you <S%H2186>off<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%>? why <S%H5641>hide<s%> you your face from <S%H6440>me<s%>?
I am <S%H6041>afflicted<s%> and ready to <S%H1478>die<s%> from my <S%H5290>youth<s%> <S%H5375>up<s%>: while I suffer your <S%H367>terrors<s%> I am <S%H6323>distracted<s%>.
Your fierce <S%H2740>wrath<s%> goes <S%H5674>over<s%> <S%H1161>me<s%>; your terrors have cut me <S%H6789>off<s%>.
They came round <S%H5437>about<s%> me <S%H3117>daily<s%> like <S%H4325>water<s%>; they <S%H5362>surrounded<s%> me about <S%H3162>together<s%>.
<S%H157>Lover<s%> and <S%H7453>friend<s%> have you put <S%H7368>far<s%> from <S%H3045>me<s%>, and mine acquaintance into <S%H4285>darkness<s%>.
